article.title: Adware
article.paragraph: Adware, oradvertising-supported software, is anysoftwarepackage that automatically renders advertisements in order to generate revenue for its author. The advertisements may be in the user interface of the software or on a screen presented to the user during the installation process. The functions may be designed to analyze which Internet sites the user visits and to present advertising pertinent to the types of goods or services featured there. The term is sometimes used to refer to software that#As malwaredisplays unwanted advertisements.cite bookMicrosoft Encyclopedia of Security [[Microsoft Press]] Redmond, Washington 2003 Mitch Tulloch Jeff Koch Sandra Haynes 16 0-7356-1877-1 Any software that installs itself on your system without your knowledge and displays advertisements when the user browses the Internet.
article.heading: Advertising-supported software
article.paragraph: In legitimate software, the advertising functions are integrated into or bundled with the program. Adware is usually seen by the developer as a way to recover development costs, and in some cases, it may allow the software to be provided to the user free of charge or at a reduced price. The income derived from presenting advertisements to the user may allow or motivate the developer to continue to develop, maintain and upgrade the software product.cite webhttp://www.zdnet.com/feature-ad-supported-software-1339291796/Feature: Ad-supported softwareDavidBraue4 September 2008[[ZDNet]]4 December 2012The use of advertising-supported software in business is becoming increasingly popular, with a third ofinformation technologyITand business executives in a 2007 survey byMcKinsey & Companyplanning to be using ad-funded software within the following two years.cite newshttp://www.informationweek.com/businesses-warm-to-no-cost-ad-supported/199204001Businesses Warm To No-Cost, Ad-Supported SoftwareMaryHayes Weier5 May 2007[[Information Week]]4 December 2012Advertisement-funded software is also one of thebusiness models for open-source software.
article.heading: In application software
article.paragraph: Some software is offered in both an advertising-supported mode and a paid, advertisement-free mode. The latter is usually available by an online purchase of a license or registration code for the software that unlocks the mode, or the purchase and download of a separate version of the software.efn<arg name="For example, in 2007 [[Microsoft]] changed its productivity suite [[Microsoft Works]] to be advertising-supported.{{cite web|url">http://www.zdnet.com/blog/microsoft/microsoft-works-to-become-a-free-ad-funded-product/604|title

Some software authors offer advertising-supported versions of their software as an alternative option to business organizations seeking to avoid paying large sums for software licenses, funding the development of the software with higher fees for advertisers.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/business/article/Ad-supported-software-reaches-specialized-audience-3501806.phpAd-supported software reaches specialized audienceAriLevy23 April 2012[[SF Gate]]4 December 2012

Examples of advertising-supported software include the Windows version of theInternet telephonyapplicationSkype,cite webhttp://www.itnews.com.au/News/250426,skype-now-free-ad-supported-software.aspxSkype now free ad-supported softwareLiamTung11 March 2011iT News for Australian Business4 December 2012and theAmazon Kindle#Kindle 3Amazon Kindle 3family ofe-book readers, which has versions called "Kindle with Special Offers" that display advertisements on the home page and in sleep mode in exchange for substantially lower pricing.cite webKindle, Wi-Fi, Graphite, 6" Display with New E Ink Pearl Technology — includes Special Offers & Sponsored Screensavershttp://www.amazon.com/Kindle-Special-Offers-Wireless-Reader/dp/B004HFS6Z0[[Amazon.com]]Amazon.com, Inc4 August 2011

In 2012,Microsoftand its advertising division,Microsoft Advertising,efn<arg name="Formed in 2008 following Microsoft's acquisition of digital marketing company [[aQuantive]].{{cite web|url">http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/newsroom/msn/factsheet/MSAdTimeline.mspx|titleannounced thatWindows 8, the forthcoming major release of theMicrosoft Windowsoperating system, would provide built-in methods for software authors to use advertising support as a business model.cite webhttp://advertising.microsoft.com/ads-in-appsWindows 8 Ads in AppsMicrosoft Advertising20 November 2012cite webhttp://community.advertising.microsoft.com/msa/en/global/b/blog/archive/2012/10/01/windows-8-ads-in-apps-concepts-agency-partners-advertising-week-2012.aspxKimStephenMicrosoft Advertising Unveils New Windows 8 Ads in Apps Concepts with Agency Partners at Advertising Week 20121 October 201220 November 2012[[Microsoft]]The idea had been considered since as early as 2005.cite newshttp://news.zdnet.com/2100-3513_22-5951569.htmlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20051124140201/http://news.zdnet.com/2100-3513_22-5951569.htmlMicrosoft eyes making desktop apps freeFriedIna[[CNET]]14 November 200520 November 2012
article.heading: In software as a service
article.paragraph: Support by advertising is a popular business model ofsoftware as a service(SaaS) on theWorld Wide WebWeb. Notable examples include the email serviceGmailcite bookTeeterRyanGoogle Apps For Dummies1-118-05240-4http://books.google.com/?idKarl Barksdale3–279 February 2011and otherGoogle Appsproducts,and the social networkFacebook.cite web17 January 2011 by Jolie O'Dell 203http://mashable.com/2011/01/17/facebooks-ad-revenue-hit-1-86b-for-2010/Facebook's Ad Revenue Hit $1.86B for 2010Mashable.com17 January 201121 December 2011cite newsWomackBrianhttp://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-09-20/facebook-revenue-will-reach-4-27-billion-emarketer-says-1-.htmlFacebook Revenue Will Reach $4.27 Billion, EMarketer SaysBloomberg20 September 201121 December 2011Microsoft has also adopted the advertising-supported model for many of itssocial softwareSaaS offerings.cite webhttp://www.zdnet.com/blog/microsoft/meet-microsoft-the-advertising-company/419Meet Microsoft, the advertising companyFoleyMary Jo3 May 2007[[ZDNet]]20 November 2012TheMicrosoft Office Liveservice was also available in an advertising-supported mode.

In the view ofFederal Trade Commissionstaff,cite webMajorasDeborah PlattFTC Staff Report. Monitoring Software on Your PC: Spyware, Adware, and Other Softwarehttp://www.ftc.gov/os/2005/03/050307spywarerpt.pdfFederal Trade Commission4 April 2005there appears to be general agreement that software should be considered "spyware" only if it is downloaded or installed on a computer without the user's knowledge and consent. However, unresolved issues remain concerning how, what, and when consumers need to be told about software installed on their computers for consent to be adequate. For instance, distributors often disclose in anEULAend-user license agreementthat there is additional software bundled with primary software, but some panelists and commenters did not view such disclosure as sufficient to infer consent to the installation of the bundled software.
article.heading: As malware
article.paragraph: The termadwareis frequently used to describe a form ofmalware(malicious software)cite webhttp://www.staysafeonline.org/stay-safe-online/keep-a-clean-machine/malware-and-botnetsMalware & Botnets[[National Cyber Security Alliance]]StaySafeOnline.orgThe terms 'spyware' and 'adware' apply to several different [malware] technologies...4 December 2012cite webhttp://www.princeton.edu/itsecurity/basics/malicious-software/Viruses and other forms of malicious software5 July 2012[[Princeton University]] Office of Information Technologymalware also includes worms, spyware and adware.4 December 2012which presents unwanted advertisements to the user of a computer.cite newshttp://www.spywareloop.com/news/adwareAdware in SpyWareLoop.comVincentas''Spyware Loop''11 July 201327 July 2013cite webhttp://www.lavasoft.com/mylavasoft/securitycenter/spyware-glossary#AdwareMalware from A to Z[[Lavasoft]][Adware] delivers advertising content potentially in a manner or context that may be unexpected and unwanted by users.4 December 2012The advertisements produced by adware are sometimes in the form of aPop-up adpop-upor sometimes in an "unclosable window".cite webhttp://www.staysafeonline.org/data-privacy-day/glossary/Data Privacy Day Glossary[[National Cyber Security Alliance]]StaySafeOnline.orgAdware: type of malware that allows popup ads on a computer system, ultimately taking over a user's Internet browsing.4 December 2012

When the term is used in this way, the severity of its implication varies. While some sources rate adware only as an "irritant",cite webhttp://www.rm.com/Support/TechnicalArticle.asp?crefSpyware, Adware and Malware — Advice for networks and network users[[RM Education]][Adware] tend[s] to be more of an irritant than do actual damage to your system, but [is] an unwanted presence nonetheless.4 December 2012others classify it as an "online threat"cite webhttp://www.mcafee.com/us/about/news/2008/20080916_120000_y.aspxMcAfee, Inc. Names Most Dangerous Celebrities in Cyberspace[[McAfee]]online threats, such as spyware, spam, phishing, adware, viruses and other malware...4 December 2012Copyavailable at Bloomberg.or even rate it as seriously ascomputer virusesandTrojan horse (computing)trojans.cite webhttp://www.ftc.gov/os/comments/spyware/040318assocofsharewareproff.pdfhttp://web.archive.org/web/20120917022453/http://www.ftc.gov/os/comments/spyware/040318assocofsharewareproff.pdf2012-09-17PDFJerrySternSpyware, Adware, Malware, Thief: Creating Business Income from Denial of Service and FraudASPects, Newsletter of the Association of Shareware Professionals[[Association of Software Professionals]]Adware has become a bad word, linked to spyware and privacy violations by everyone except the publishers of the products... [it was] a good thing ten or fifteen years ago, and [is] bad now... [t]he lines for adware are even being blended into virus and trojan territory.The precise definition of the term in this context also varies.efn<arg name="A workshop held by the [[Federal Trade Commission]] in 2005 asked representatives of the computer, electronic advertising, and anti-spyware product industries, as well as representatives of trade associations, government agencies, consumer and privacy advocacy groups, to try and define adware and its relation to spyware, and did not find a clear consensus.{{cite book|url">http://books.google.co.uk/books?idAdware that observes the computer user's activities without their consent and reports it to the software's author is calledspyware.cite bookhttp://books.google.co.uk/books?idInternet and the Law: Technology, Society, and CompromisesSchwabachAaron10978-1-85109-731-92005[[ABC-CLIO]]4 December 2012

Programs that have been developed to detect, quarantine, and remove advertisement-displaying malware, include:Ad-Aware,Malwarebytes' Anti-Malware,Spyware DoctorandSpybot - Search & Destroy. In addition, almost all commercialantivirus softwarecurrently detect adware and spyware, or offer a separate detection module.cite webhttp://www.microsoft.com/windowsxp/using/security/expert/honeycutt_spyware.mspxHow to protect your computer from Spyware and AdwareMicrosoft.comMicrosoft corporation20 April 2004JerryHoneycutthttps://web.archive.org/web/20060207042601/http://www.microsoft.com/windowsxp/using/security/expert/honeycutt_spyware.mspx7 February 2006
